dialogueTree.characterInternalMonologue: Why is someone trying to sell me a pen? I barely have time for this. I have so many responsibilities to take care of, but I guess being open to others is important too. Maybe there's something valuable in this encounter.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: They seem eager. I wonder if they understand my situation.

options.text: This pen is perfect for jotting down your thoughts and plans. It can help you stay organized.
options.characterResponse: That sounds useful! I do have a lot on my plate. I appreciate you thinking of my needs.

options.text: This pen is the latest model! Everyone's buying it!
options.characterResponse: That's nice, but I'm not really interested in trends. I focus more on practicality.

options.text: You just need to trust me, it's a good pen.
options.characterResponse: Trust you? I don’t even know you. That’s not how this works.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: They seem to be listening. Perhaps I can open up a bit.

options.text: I understand that life can be chaotic. This pen can help you channel your thoughts during tough times.
options.characterResponse: I really appreciate that perspective. It’s nice to hear someone acknowledge the chaos.

options.text: What you really need is a pen that looks good.
options.characterResponse: Looks are not my priority. I need something functional.

options.text: Honestly, everyone needs a pen. Just buy it!
options.characterResponse: That’s rude. I’m not just a number to sell to.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: I’m starting to connect, but I need to ensure they understand my values.

options.text: This pen can be a tool for your goals, just like I aim to help others with my skills.
options.characterResponse: That resonates with me. I do believe in helping others and being responsible.

options.text: You should think about how much money you can make by selling this pen.
options.characterResponse: I’m not motivated by money. That’s not what I’m looking for.

options.text: Just think of it as a way to impress people.
options.characterResponse: Impressing others is not my goal. I find that superficial.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: I feel like they’re starting to understand me. This could work.

options.text: I believe this pen will help you express your feelings and creativity, just like I try to do.
options.characterResponse: That’s a lovely thought. I do enjoy writing and expressing myself.

options.text: You just need to get the pen and stop overthinking.
options.characterResponse: It’s not about overthinking; it’s about being considerate.

options.text: Trust me, you’ll want this pen to show people you mean business.
options.characterResponse: That’s not the kind of relationship I want with a pen.

steps.characterInternalMonologue: I hope they see the value in this pen, just as I see value in my relationships.

options.text: This pen is a small but meaningful way to keep your promises and commitments.
options.characterResponse: You’re right. It’s about keeping promises and being dependable. I’ll take it.

options.text: It’s just a pen, but you should just get it anyway.
options.characterResponse: That doesn’t inspire any confidence in me. I need more than that.

options.text: You should buy it just to get me off your back.
options.characterResponse: That’s not a reason to buy anything. I’m done here.

dialogueTree.successEnding: Camila smiles warmly, takes the pen, and nods, recognizing the connection made. 'Thank you, this really means a lot to me.'
dialogueTree.failureEnding: Camila shakes her head, backing away. 'I can’t do this right now. I’ll pass.'
